moves.4. O-O Bf6: So many attacks hinge on attacking the pawn vulnerabilities of f7, g7, and even h7.  Surely there are downsides to this, but the bishop was going to be rather passive on e7.  It does use a tempo.
moves.5. c3 c6 6. d4 Nd7: This position is more interesting than many I have played.
moves.10. Bxf6 Nxf3+ 11. Kf1: Unexpected.  Perhaps he thinks I really have a system of this and that he is taking me out of my preparation.  No such luck for him.
moves.11... Nxe1 12. Kxe1 dxc4 13. Qe2 gxf6 14: Regained the tempo back.  Of course he sacrificed so much material that a tempo is rather immaterial at this point.
moves.15. Qb4 Qd7 16. Qd4: I am significantly up at this point.  Offering an exchange hastens defeat.
